title: Former Junior World Champion Nikhat Zareen Feels She's Better Than Mary Kom And Demands A Trial Bout To Prove It!
text:
Former Junior World Champion Nikhat Zareen Feels She's Better Than Mary Kom And Demands A Trial Bout To Prove It!

Former Junior World Champion Nikhat Zareen Feels She's Better Than Mary Kom And Demands A Trial Bout To Prove It!

Nikhat Zareen has sought permission from Sports Minister Kiren Rijiju for a trial bout against Mary Kom before India's squad the Olympic Qualifiers is chosen.

Mary bagged her eighth world medal at the championships. She was picked instead of Zareen. Zareen was not granted trial the BFI.

bccl

The qualifiers start in February 2020.

"Sir, the very basis of sport is Fairplay and need to keep proving oneself each and every time. Even Olympic gold medallists have to fight again to qualify to represent the country," wrote Zareen.

"I have been inspired by Mary Kom since I was a teenager. The best way I can do justice to this inspiration was to strive to be as great a boxer as her. And Mary Kom is too big a legend in sport to need to hide from the competition and not actually defend her Olympic qualification," she said.

"After all, if 23-time gold-medallist Michael Phelps has to re-qualify every time for the Olympics, the rest of us should do the same."

Mary has no problems with what BFI decides.

bccl

Zareen said she would have no regrets if she lost the bout, but at least would be content that she got a chance to prove herself.

"I look for no favours, just fairplay. And whether Mary Kom or any other boxer qualifies after the trial, we can at least sleep at night knowing that every one of the candidates for the best possible opportunity to make India proud at Olympics," she said.

With Inputs From PTI.
